--- title: "Adding rows and columns" format: html --- Data can be added to a __tibble__ by various methods. this includes: - Adding a new row or column with [`tibble::add_row()`](https://tibble.tidyverse.org/reference/add_row.html) and [`tibble::add_column()`](https://tibble.tidyverse.org/reference/add_column.html). - Binding rows or columns with [Dplyr](/dplyr/bind_tibbles.qmd) ## Create example tibbles Before demonstrating various examples we will create a few __tibbles__. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} num_tbl <- tibble::tibble(x = 1:3, y = 4:6, z = 7:9) num_tbl_2 <- tibble::tibble(aa = 11:13, ab = 14:16, ac = 17:19) num_tbl_3 <- tibble::tibble(x = 4:6, y = 7:9, z = 10:12) mixed_tbl <- tibble::tibble(number = 1:3, word = c("one","two","three"), logical = c(TRUE,FALSE,TRUE)) ``` ::: ## Adding one row or column Adding one new column or row can be carried out with the intuitively named functions: - [`tibble::add_column()`](https://tibble.tidyverse.org/reference/add_column.html): Add one or more columns to a __tibble__ - [`tibble::add_row()`](https://tibble.tidyverse.org/reference/add_row.html): Add one or more rows to a __tibble__ ### Adding a column We will add a column to the __tibble__ `num_tbl`. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} num_tbl ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 3 x y z 1 1 4 7 2 2 5 8 3 3 6 9 ``` ::: ::: To add a new column you can provide `tibble::add_column()` with a vector that is the same length as the number of rows. In the below example the new column will have the name __aa__. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} num_tbl_added_col <- tibble::add_column(num_tbl, aa = 10:12) num_tbl_added_col ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 4 x y z aa 1 1 4 7 10 2 2 5 8 11 3 3 6 9 12 ``` ::: ::: ### Adding a row We will add a row to the __tibble__ `mixed_tbl`. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mixed_tbl ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 3 number word logical 1 1 one TRUE 2 2 two FALSE 3 3 three TRUE ``` ::: ::: To add a row you can use `tibble::add_row()`. Each column of the __tibble__ needs to be specified as an option with its added value. Each value must have the same class as the column it is being added to. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mixed_tbl_add_row <- tibble::add_row(mixed_tbl, number = 4, word = "four", logical = FALSE) mixed_tbl_add_row ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 4 × 3 number word logical 1 1 one TRUE 2 2 two FALSE 3 3 three TRUE 4 4 four FALSE ``` ::: ::: ## Binding a tibble to a tibble

__Tibbles__ can be bound together to create a new __tibble__ with `dplyr::bind_cols()` and `dplyr::bind_rows()`. Please view the [Dplyr bind tibbles page](/dplyr/bind_tibbles.qmd) for examples.
